com.viaoa.util

Class OADateTime

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.viaoa.util.OADateTime
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Comparable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    OADate, OATime

    public class OADateTime
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Comparable
    Superclass of OADate and OATime that combines Calendar, Date and SimpleDateFormat. 'Hms', 'Mdy' yyyyMMdd_HHmmss.SSS hhmmssa

    Formatting Symbols used for output display. 

        G  era designator          (Text)              AD
    y  year                    (Number)            1996
    M  month in year           (Text & Number)     July & 07
    d  day in month            (Number)            10
    h  hour in am/pm (1~12)    (Number)            12
    H  hour in day (0~23)      (Number)            0
    m  minute in hour          (Number)            30
    s  second in minute        (Number)            55
    S  millisecond             (Number)            978
    E  day in week             (Text)              Tuesday
    D  day in year             (Number)            189
    F  day of week in month    (Number)            2 (2nd Wed in July)
    w  week in year            (Number)            27
    W  week in month           (Number)            2
    a  am/pm marker            (Text)              PM
    k  hour in day (1~24)      (Number)            24
    K  hour in am/pm (0~11)    (Number)            0
    z  time zone               (Text)              Pacific Standard Time
    '  escape for text         (Delimiter)
    '' single quote            (Literal)           '

    Examples:
    "yyyy.MM.dd G 'at' HH:mm:ss z"    ->>  1996.07.10 AD at 15:08:56 PDT
    "EEE, MMM d, ''yy"                ->>  Wed, July 10, '96
    "h:mm a"                          ->>  12:08 PM
    "hh 'o''clock' a, zzzz"           ->>  12 o'clock PM, Pacific Daylight Time
    "K:mm a, z"                       ->>  0:00 PM, PST
    "yyyy.MMMMM.dd GGG hh:mm aaa"    ->>  1996.July.10 AD 12:08 PM
    "yyyy.MM.dd HH:mm:ss.SSS"

    Formatting is used to convert OADateTime to a String and also for parsing a String to create an OADateTime.

    Note: OADateTimes are not affected by timezone. A date/time created on one system will be the same on another machine, even if the timezone is different.

    See Also:
    setGlobalOutputFormat(java.lang.String), SimpleDateFormat, Serialized Form

      static OADateTime valueOf(java.lang.String strDateTime, java.lang.String fmt)
      Static method for converting a String date to an OADateTime.
      If date is " " (space) then todays date will be returned.
      If date is null or "" then null is returned.

      • addDays

        public OADateTime addDays(int amount)
        Return an OADateTime where a specified amount of days is added.

        Note: if this is an instanceof OADate or OATime, then the returned object will be the same type.

        Parameters:
        amount - number of days to increment/deincrement (negative number).
        Returns:
        new OADateTime object.

        obj - Date, OADateTime, Calendar, etc that can be converted to an OADateTime.

      • convert

        protected OADateTime convert(java.lang.Object obj,
                 boolean bAlways)
        Convert an Object to an OADateTime.

      • valueOf

        public static OADateTime valueOf(java.lang.String strDateTime,
                 java.lang.String fmt)
        Static method for converting a String date to an OADateTime.
        If date is " " (space) then todays date will be returned.
        If date is null or "" then null is returned.
        Parameters:
        fmt - format of date. If not valid, then staticParseFormats and staticOutputFormat will be used.
        Returns:
        OADateTime or null
        See Also:
        setFormat(java.lang.String), to convert a string using global parse strings

      • fixDate

        protected static java.lang.String fixDate(java.lang.String s)
        Internally used to fix a String date.

      • valueOf

        public static OADateTime valueOf(java.lang.String strDateTime)
        Converts a String date to an OADateTime.
        If value is " " (space) then todays date/time will be returned.
        If value is null or "" then null is returned.
        StaticParseFormats and staticOutputFormat will be used to try to convert.
        Returns:
        OADateTime or null
        See Also:
        setFormat(java.lang.String), setGlobalOutputFormat(java.lang.String), addGlobalParseFormat(java.lang.String), #getGlobalParseFormats, valueOf(String,String)

      • valueOfMain

        protected static java.util.Date valueOfMain(java.lang.String value,
                         java.lang.String inputFormat,
                         java.util.Vector vec,
                         java.lang.String outputFormat)

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Converts OADateTime to a String using specified formatting String.
        Uses the first format that has been set: "format", "staticOutputFormat" else or "yyyy-MMM-dd hh:mma"
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object

      • setFormat

        public void setFormat(java.lang.String fmt)
        Set format to use for this OADateTime This format will be used when converting this datetime to a String, unless a format is specified when calling toString.
        See Also:
        OADateTime, toString()
